definition: to elect as/to choose as/to consider as
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: Attica is defined by avantgarde design and top-notch sound from a world-class system.
sentences.chinese: 爱奇多被评为设计前卫且音响设备顶尖的俱乐部。

sentences.english: Hebei Province in 1980 was named high-quality brand-name flavor of food.
sentences.chinese: 1980年又被评为河北省优质风味食品名牌产品。

sentences.english: Heckles?Wow, Heckles was voted class clown, and so was I.
sentences.chinese: 哇，Heckles被评为班里的开心果，我也是。

sentences.english: Currently the Atlas is being human-rated by ULA.
sentences.chinese: 目前阿特拉斯被人评为ULA。

sentences.english: I was chosen as one of“The Big Ten Prominent Youths”of Beijing in 1996.
sentences.chinese: 我1996年被评为“北京市十大杰出青年”。

sentences.english: He was rated as one of '1986 Shanghai People in Cultural News'.
sentences.chinese: 被评为1986年度上海文化新闻人物。

sentences.english: Just recently, the station was also named the whole coal sample fine station.
sentences.chinese: 就在前不久，该站场还被评为全煤样板精品站场。

sentences.english: I was honored as a" Three Virtues" in university serval times.
sentences.chinese: 我在大学里有好几次被评为“三好学生”。

sentences.english: Guangzhou has been awarded the title of "International Garden City" by the International Garden Association.
sentences.chinese: 广州市被国际公园协会评为“国际花园城市”。

sentences.english: It was rated as 'excellent' by the national funding council.
sentences.chinese: 它被评为由国家拨款的优秀大学。

sentences.english: Many years are evaluated by Beijing Bureau of industry and commerce Beijing to keep words continuously the enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 连续多年被北京市工商局评为北京市守信企业。

sentences.english: Xiong Linbo was named one of the ten eminent doctors in Yueyang City in 2008
sentences.chinese: 熊林波2008年被评为岳阳市首界十大名医。

sentences.english: In 1996, Jiaozhou City was chosen as "Hometown of Folk Art of China".
sentences.chinese: 1996年胶州市被评为“中国民间艺术之乡”。

sentences.english: Many people describe the goji berry plant as a mix between a grape vine, and a tomato creeper.
sentences.chinese: 很多人形容评为浆果厂作为组合之间，葡萄，番茄蔓。

sentences.english: In 1999 was named senior teacher at the school.
Kunqu Opera is rated by UNESCO as Oral and Non-material Heritage of Mankind.
sentences.chinese: 昆曲评为“人类口头和非物质文化遗产”。

definition: be honored with
to select on the basis of a vote or consensus
to award/to confer
name/term of address/title
(of a list, music chart etc) to reach the top
(official accolade) advanced individual/exemplary individual
(official accolade) advanced team/exemplary group
called/to call sth (by a name)/to name
to be classified as
publicly known (to be)/accepted (as)
to rank (number 1, or third last etc)/to be among (those who are in a particular group)
to label/to call
special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
to be chosen/to be elected as
gold medal/first prize
prize/award/encouragement/CL:個|个[ge4]
